revised_title: Exploring the Phenomena of Optical Spectra and Color Changes in Retinal Images
tldr: The author investigates the circumstances and principles that regulate the production of images on the retina of the human eye, focusing on color changes and their endurance under different light conditions. The study reveals that the intensity of the light impression plays a significant role in the colors and changes observed in retinal images. The author also explores the practical applications of this research, such as determining the relative degrees of illumination and selecting harmonious colors in art.
